snippet: After his father died, Paul D. Ryan formed a self-reliance that would shape his worldview and one day capture the imagination of Mitt Romney.
abstract: Representative Paul D Ryan began developing self-reliance and a political philosophy as a teen after his father died that has culminated into a defining role as a vice-presidential candidate; in Ryan, Mitt Romney has found not only a sympathetic life story to animate his campaign but also a politician who fills in what many see as the gaps in Romney’s conservative bona fides (Series: The Long Run).

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER, JIM RUTENBERG, MIKE McINTIRE and SHERYL GAY STOLBERG
byline.contributor: Jennifer Steinhauer reported from Janesville, Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Washington, and Jim Rutenberg and Mike McIntire from New York. Nicholas Confessore contributed reporting from New York, and Serge Kovaleski from Denver. Kitty Bennett contributed research from Seattle, and Sheelagh McNeill from New York.

lead_paragraph: After his father died, Paul D. Ryan formed a self-reliance that would shape his worldview and one day capture the imagination of Mitt Romney.

headline.seo: Family, Faith and Politics Describe Life of Paul Ryan
